streams

Class Streams

  • java.lang.Object
    • streams.Streams

  • public final class Streams
extends java.lang.Object
    A static helper class for the Stream interface.
    Version:
    0.1.1
    Author:
    hugo benichi
    See Also:
    Stream

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static <E> Stream<E> from(java.lang.Iterable<? extends E> sequence)
        Factory method which takes an Iterable object and wraps it inside a Stream object produced on the fly as an anonymous instance of AbstractStream. This anonymous instance simply stores a reference to the iterable object and implements Iterable#iterator by delegation to the underlying Iterable object.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the returned Stream.
        Parameters:
        sequence - an instance of Iterable serving as the base for the returned Stream object. The parameter type of this Iterable can be a subtype of E. Returns null if sequence is null.
        Returns:
        a Stream object.
        See Also:
        Stream, AbstractStream

      • take

        public static <E> java.util.List<E> take(Stream<? extends E> stream,
                         int n)
        Takes the first n elements of a Stream and returns them in a list in iteration order.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the returned List stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - the input stream to buffer into a List. Its type parameter can be a subtype of E. Returns null is stream is null.
        n - the number of elements to take from the stream and put into the returned list. If stream has less than n elements or if n is negative then all the elements selected. If n is zero an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        a list which contains the first n elements of the stream in iteration order.

      • buffer

        public static <E> Stream<E> buffer(Stream<E> stream)
        Buffers internally a Stream to avoid rerunning expensive operations (not yet implemented).
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the input stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - a stream to buffer. Returns null if stream is null.
        Returns:
        a wrapping stream which will automatically buffer new computed values.

      • last

        public static <E> E last(Stream<E> stream)
        Returns the last value of a Stream. Used by AbstractStream in conjunction with Stream#map and Streams#fold_with_map to implement Stream#fold and Stream#reduce.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the input stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - a Stream object. Returns null is stream is null.
        Returns:
        the last value of this Stream or null if it is empty.
        See Also:
        AbstractStream.fold(streams.Operator<F, E>), fold_with_map(streams.Stream<E>, streams.Function<? super E, F>)

      • fold_with_map

        public static <E,F> F fold_with_map(Stream<E> stream,
                    Function<? super E,F> folding_adapter)
        Helper function for implementation of AbstractStream#fold and #reduce. Maps a stream with a Function object and returns the last object of this mapped stream. The Function object is actually a closure wrapping a fold operation and returns the updated state of the fold for every items in the input stream. Therefore the result of the fold is found in the last item of the mapped Stream.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the type of the stream to fold.
        F - the return type of the fold operation.
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to fold. Returns null if stream is null.
        folding_adapter - a closure wrapping a fold operation and presented as a Function instance to adapt to Stream#map interface.
        Returns:
        the result of the fold operation.
        See Also:
        AbstractStream.fold(streams.Operator<F, E>), last(streams.Stream<E>)
